trans-unit.source: While we try to be sustainable through subscriptions and services, it's favorable to receive donations to keep everything as free as possible. As a non-profit, funding is what allows us to continue to develop free and open-source software and push to provide free or affordable services.
trans-unit.target: We try to keep Elypia running by using the money we get from repeating payments or services we might provide for users. It's still helpful to get donations so we can keep prices low or free if we can.

trans-unit.source: Where third-party scripts is embedded from other websites, third-party cookies may also be added.
trans-unit.target: Where there is content from other websites, they can set cookies too.

trans-unit.source: This is a manually defined list of cookies or storage data that may be set while using our website or services.
trans-unit.target: A typed up list of cookies or storage data this website sets on your browser.

trans-unit.note: Background color from Elypia color palette.
Foreground color from Elypia color palette.

trans-unit.source: Documentation on Cookies via MDN Web Docs (Mozilla)
trans-unit.target: Info on Cookies via MDN Web Docs

trans-unit.source: The ePrivacy directive, also known as the EU Cookie Law, is what covers the use of cookies (or other client-side storage mediums) and consent. We minimize the use of cookies and storage without reducing functionality on the websites or services. We do not, and most likely never will, use or add analytic cookies, or trackers, however we do store some data for technical or client-side configuration purposes.
trans-unit.target: The ePrivacy directive, also known as the EU Cookie Law, is what covers the use of cookies and other ways to store data on a clients machine. We avoid using cookies and storage . We don't, and most likely never will, use or add cookies that collect your data or track what you do. We do use cookies and storage for the website to work, and configuration purposes.

trans-unit.source: Definition and Requirements for Data Protection Officer

If there are any concerns or questions regarding our privacy policy, or if you have a request, please send an email to dpo@elypia.org where the elected Data Protection Officer (DPO) will be able to support you.
trans-unit.target: If there are any questions about our privacy policy, please email dpo@elypia.org where you can talk to the Data Protection Officer (DPO) .

trans-unit.source: We're using CloudFlare as a Content Delivery Network (CDN) which collects and allows us to view aggregate data on traffic such as total requests, number of unique visitors, and which countries are predominantly accessing our services.
trans-unit.target: We use CloudFlare as a Content Delivery Network (CDN) which collects and lets us to see merged data on traffic like total requests, number of visitors, and which countries accessed our websites most.

trans-unit.source: Documentation on User-Agent via MDN Web Docs (Mozilla)
trans-unit.target: Info on User-Agent on MDN Web Docs

trans-unit.source: None of our websites or services store personal information on users, and our web servers is configured with the access log disabled so we do not see information regarding your request such as IP or user-agent.
trans-unit.target: We don't store personal information, and our servers are configured with the access log disabled, so we don't see info about your request like IP or user-agent.

trans-unit.source: This privacy policy only refers to what is running on Elypia's servers regardless of what website or service you're using. If you're connected to a third-party host; you should read the respective privacy policy for your host.
trans-unit.target: The privacy policy only talks about what's on our servers. If you're using hosted by someone that isn't us then you should read their privacy policy instead.

trans-unit.source: Elypia wants to aid the future of software and technology by providing FOSS (free and open-source software) to the public. We want to see more libraries and frameworks that allow junior developers to create enterprise grade applications for small-scale purposes, ready to take that knowledge with them to support other projects and businesses. We also want to help create modern, secure, and reliable software, that can be referenced or derived for small businesses without worrying about legacy applications that are no longer supported with no viable or affordable alternative.
trans-unit.target: Elypia will aid the future of software and tech by making free and open-source software. We want to see more libraries and frameworks that help new developers create good and tested software for smaller purposes, and ready to take what they learn with them to help others and businesses. We want to help make modern, secure, and reliable software that can be used or taken for small businesses without worrying about old applications that are not updated anymore but have no good and cheap replacements.

trans-unit.source: Elypia CIC on Public Record at Companies House
trans-unit.target: Elypia CIC on Public Record at Companies House

trans-unit.source: A Community Interest Company is a non-profit organization in the United Kingdom which has the structure of a limited company, but pledges to use its surplus for community benefit, as opposed to the benefit of its directors. As a CIC, Elypia has a responsibility to follow its Articles of Association and Community Interest Statement which can both be found on the Companies House website. All projects Elypia takes on will adhere to the objectives in the aforementioned documents.
trans-unit.target: A Community Interest Company is a non-profit company in the United Kingdom which is like a limited company, but doesn't give its profit to those running or working in the company. As a Community Interest Company, Elypia must follow its Articles of Association and Community Interest Statement which can be found at Companies House website. All projects Elypia takes on will meet the objectives in the documents.

trans-unit.source: Wikipedia article for Community Interest Company
trans-unit.target: Wikipedia page for Community Interest Company

trans-unit.source: Elypia CIC is a non-profit Community Interest Company based in the United Kingdom that wants to bring more free and open-source software to different sectors. This is starting with software development, aimed at junior developers, and will hopefully move towards other areas outside of software that may aid educational institutions or less developed sectors attain alternatives over abandoned legacy applications.
trans-unit.target: Elypia CIC is a non-profit Community Interest Company in England that wants to make free and open-source software for different sectors. This is starting with software, aimed at new developers, and will move toward other areas outside of software that may help with education or less developed sectors attain more choices over older software.

trans-unit.source: Anime girl styled drawing of Elypia-chan by Vukory
trans-unit.target: Anime girl styled drawing of Elypia-chan by Vukory

trans-unit.source: We want to make enterprise grade software development simpler to learn and utilize, and to support sectors that aren't up-to-date or stuck by legacy proprietary abandonware.
trans-unit.target: We want business level software to be easier make and use. We'll support sectors that aren't modern and stuck with closed source software.

trans-unit.source: We love free and open-source software!
trans-unit.target: We love free and open-source software!

trans-unit.source: You don't need to know how to code to contribute and support Elypia; come translate on Weblate!
trans-unit.target: You don't need to know how to code to help Elypia, come translate on Weblate!

trans-unit.source: It looks like you're new here so we brought up registration form instead for you!
trans-unit.target: It looks like you're new, so we pulled up the register form for you.

trans-unit.source: Password must be between 8 and 72 characters!
trans-unit.target: Your password must be 8 to 72 characters!

trans-unit.source: Please enter a valid email address!
trans-unit.target: Type in a real email address.

trans-unit.source: You'll be asked to verify it post-registration!
trans-unit.target: You'll have to prove it's yours after registering.

trans-unit.source: You can download, modify, reference, or redistribute them as you see fit for any purpose, including commercial.
trans-unit.target: You can download, modify, use, or share them however you want, and even make money with it.

trans-unit.source: The Elypia Emotes are a free and open-source set of cute red panda emoticons available under the Apache license.
trans-unit.target: The Elypia Emotes are free and open-source set of red panda emotes.

trans-unit.source: All wraps have been abstracted as to make it more consistent between web services you're implementing and maximize pooling resources.
trans-unit.target: Each API uses the same interface so it's very consistent and tries to reuse resources.

trans-unit.source: Elypiai is a small but useful library that provides wraps for many APIs available online that don't already have official implementations.
trans-unit.target: Elypiai is a library that wraps web APIs online that don't have official libraries already.

trans-unit.source: This is great for applications where you want to have a UI for users to tailor their experience without having to write your own web service dedicated to the generic job we all need.
trans-unit.target: This is good for applications where you want to have an interface for users to configure things without having to make your own website.

trans-unit.source: Confiler is a small service which can be online or self-hosted, it's a cloud configuration service which will allow users to define entities to process or store configuration for them.
trans-unit.target: Confiler is a service which can be used online or locally. It's a configuration service so you can let users configure settings and store configurations for them.

trans-unit.source: Commandler will handle all the work so it keeps implementing commands quick and simple while the bulk of the work is handled by the framework.
trans-unit.target: Commandler will handle the work so you can just implement the commands you want and leave most of the work to the framework.

trans-unit.source: Commandler is a generic command handling framework for Java that allows you to write your code once and integrate it anywhere or multiple places in a single application.
trans-unit.target: Commandler is a command handling framework for Java. It allows you to write commands once and work with lots of chat services at once.

trans-unit.source: Alexis is a free and open-source multi-purpose chatbot for Discord and provides various integrations and moderation features to help you have fun, and automate manage and moderation of your guild!
trans-unit.target: Alexis is a free and open-source chatbot for Discord. She links with lots of websites and has features to moderate and increase activity in your guild.

trans-unit.source: Elypia Logo without Fill by Nikky
trans-unit.target: Elypia Logo without Fill by Nikky

trans-unit.source: Don't use the Elypia branding where it may suggest we endorse your content.
trans-unit.target: Don't place our logo where it looks like we worked with you or like what you've made.

trans-unit.source: Other than as explicitly stated, don't modify or reconfigure the Elypia logo.
trans-unit.target: Don't make changes to the logo unless we said you can do it.

trans-unit.source: Keeping the logo as-is is preferred, but you may alter the hue.
trans-unit.target: Don't make changes to the logo unless it's the hue.

trans-unit.source: This is for users or publishers that may want to reference Elypia and use it's branding. This page covers some assets that can be used, and any guidelines to using them.
trans-unit.target: This is for anyone that wants to use our branding. This page assets you can use, and rules to using them.

trans-unit.source: Contribute to this sites Source Code on GitLab
This is the registered office and correspondence address for Elypia, not base of work or residence.
trans-unit.target: This is the registered office and correspondence address for Elypia, not where we work.

trans-unit.source: You can support us by purchasing our branded merchandise.
trans-unit.target: You can support us by buying our merchandise.

trans-unit.source: If you have a PayPal account you can donate using the attached credit/debit card, bank account, or PayPal balance.
trans-unit.target: If you have a PayPal account you can donate using the attached card, bank account, or PayPal balance.

trans-unit.source: Donate directly on the site with your debit or credit card. All donations using this method are processed by Stripe; we won't process or store your information.
trans-unit.target: Donate here with your debit or credit card. Donations using this method are processed by Stripe, not us, so we won't receive your data.

trans-unit.source: Donate by transfering money or setting up a standing order directly to our company bank account.
trans-unit.target: Donate by sending money or setting up a standing order to our bank account.

trans-unit.source: At present most costs are for technical infrastructure or legal obligations to keep Elypia CIC and it's websites and services up. This includes domains, hosting, content delivery, travel or paperwork, and any annual fees or requirements in order to fulfill company wide obligations under legal justification. Some projects may incur costs if new assets or branding is desired for them. We are hopeful that in the future Elypia will be able to provide salaries to those contributing and managing Elypia's projects.
trans-unit.target: Right now most costs are for keeping the website and services running or to meet legal requirements. This includes domains, hosting, content delivery, travel or paperwork, and any annual fees to meet company wide obligations that we're legally required to do. Some projects can have costs like if we image or branding. We currently don't, but hoping to pay those contributing and managing Elypia's projects in future.

trans-unit.source: As a Community Interest Company we will also be able to generate income through selling subscriptions and services or by providing hosted solutions for our open-source projects. Donations will not be the only form of income for Elypia but strongly encouraged and appreciated.
trans-unit.target: As a Community Interest Company we can make money by selling things to users like cloud-hosting for our open-source solutions. Donations are not the only way we make money but does help a lot.

trans-unit.target: Info on Storage from MDN Web Docs
